Horrormoviesdata_modified <- HorrorMoviesdata %>% tidyr::drop_na()
Horrormoviesdata_modified
# A tibble: 50 × 12
   Ranking Movie                   Avg resting heart ra…¹ Avg movie heart rate…²
     <dbl> <chr>                                    <dbl>                  <dbl>
 1       1 Sinister                                    64                     86
 2       2 Host                                        64                     88
 3       3 Skinamirink                                 64                     84
 4       4 Insidious                                   64                     85
 5       5 The Conjuring                               64                     84
 6       6 Hereditary                                  64                     82
 7       7 Smile                                       64                     83
 8       8 The Excorcism of Emily…                     64                     82
 9       9 Hell House LLC                              64                     81
10      10 Talk To Me                                  64                     79
# ℹ 40 more rows
# ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​`Avg resting heart rate (BPM)`,
#   ²​`Avg movie heart rate (BPM)`
# ℹ 8 more variables: `Overall difference (BPM)` <dbl>,
#   `HRV Difference (%)` <dbl>, `Highest spike (BPM)` <dbl>,
#   `Scare Score` <dbl>, `This film is a sequel.` <chr>,
#   `This film has at least one sequel` <chr>, `Rotten Tomato score` <dbl>, …
Horrormoviesdata_modified <- Horrormoviesdata_modified %>%
  mutate(
    Movie = as.factor(Movie),
    `This film is a sequel.` = as.factor(`This film is a sequel.`),
    `This film has at least one sequel` = as.factor(`This film has at least one sequel`)
  ) %>%
  dplyr::relocate(where(is.factor), .after = Ranking)

## Counting by the obvious factor variables
Horrormoviesdata_modified %>%
  dplyr::count(`This film has at least one sequel`) %>%
  tt()

no 23
yes 27 
Horrormoviesdata_modified %>%
  count(across(where(is.factor))) %>%
  tally()
